item.title: The characterizations of monotone functions which generate associative functions
item.description:
arXiv:2409.02941v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Associativity of a two-place function $T: [0,1]^2ightarrow [0,1]$ defined by $T(x,y)=f^{(-1)}(F(f(x),f(y)))$ where $F:[0,\infty]^2ightarrow[0,\infty]$ is an associative function, $f: [0,1]ightarrow [0,\infty]$ is a monotone function which satisfies either $f(x)=f(x^{+})$ when $f(x^{+})\in \mbox{Ran}(f)$ or $f(x)
eq f(y)$ for any $y
eq x$ when $f(x^{+})
otin \mbox{Ran}(f)$ for all $x\in[0,1]$ and $f^{(-1)}:[0,\infty]ightarrow[0,1]$ is a pseudo-inverse of $f$ depends only on properties of the range of $f$. The necessary and sufficient conditions for the $T$ to be associative are presented by applying the properties of the monotone function $f$.
item.dc:creator: Chen Meng, Yun-Mao Zhang, Xue-ping Wang
